glsa.title: mod_wsgi: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities have been found in mod_wsgi, the worst of which could result in local privilege escalation.

background.p: mod_wsgi is an Apache2 module for running Python WSGI applications.

description.p: Two vulnerabilities have been found in mod_wsgi:

ul.li: Error codes returned by setuid are not properly handled (CVE-2014-0240)
A memory leak exists via the “Content-Type” header (CVE-2014-0242)

impact.p: A local attacker may be able to gain escalated privileges. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to obtain sensitive information.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All mod_wsgi users should upgrade to the latest version:
